intro: Anisacantha kentropsidea, commonly known as the rock fig, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Anisacantha kentropsidea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
